headline: “Mwizi! Mwizi! Mwizi! Dramatic scenes as man killed in Bulemia village, Busia county for alleged chicken theft
author: Paul nyongesa

breadcrumbs.name: “Mwizi! Mwizi! Mwizi! Dramatic scenes as man killed in Bulemia village, Busia county for alleged chicken theft

description: A man in-his-thirties has succumbed to head injuries after being beaten to a pulp by angry mob in Busia’s Butula town. According to residents prior to the incident, the man yet to be identified is said to have sneaked into the house in one of the village located at Bulemia area and grabbed one hen
articleBody:
Total Views : 139

A man in-his-thirties has succumbed to head injuries after being beaten to a pulp by angry mob in Busia’s Butula town.

According to residents prior to the incident, the man yet to be identified is said to have sneaked into the house in one of the village located at Bulemia area and grabbed one hen and three sufurias.

But a neighbour who spotted the suspect trying to escape after he had concealed the chicken and three sufurias in a gunnysack at the time of the incident raised an alarm attracting an angry mob that caught up with the suspect and subjected him to a thorough beating.

The victim took to his heels upon learning that he had been cornered in a desperate attempt to escape from the rowdy mob who were baying for his blood.

The body of the deceased has since been transferred to Sega Mortuary as the Directorate of Criminal investigation have launched an investigation into the matter.

Cases of mob justice have been on the rise in the country raising concerns in the security sector.

On August 6, four men Fred Mureithi aged 30, his younger brother Victor Mwangi, and their two cousins Mike George both aged 29, and 28-year-old Nicholas Musa were lynched by an angry mob in Kitengela on suspicion of being livestock thieves.

Their families said the victims had gone to Kitengela for a birthday and a housewarming party when they were ambushed as they walked to a kiosk to buy dinner. They were in three motorcycles.

Witness accounts indicated the four were attacked near a river around Kisaju area at 6pm, as they looked for a kiosk to buy food.

The main suspect believed to have orchestrated the murder was later arrested on August 17 by the DCI detectives.

headline: Nyanza MP suggests constitutionally a DP isn’t allowed to think for himself and oppose president
author: Joshua Wanga

breadcrumbs.name: Nyanza MP suggests constitutionally a DP isn’t allowed to think for himself and oppose president

description: A member of parliament belonging to the Orange Democratic Movement party has now quoted a part of the constitution which outlines the duties and roles of a Deputy President in Kenya to not only castigate the current Deputy President, William Ruto, but to also assert quite an unusual Job Description that should be expected from
articleBody:
Total Views : 133

A member of parliament belonging to the Orange Democratic Movement party has now quoted a part of the constitution which outlines the duties and roles of a Deputy President in Kenya to not only castigate the current Deputy President, William Ruto, but to also assert quite an unusual Job Description that should be expected from the holder of the office.

Ugunja MP James Opiyo Wandayi was speaking while appearing on Citizen TV’s daily morning show Daybreak which was hosted by the station’s presenter Sam Gituku. Alongside Wandayi in the studio was political analyst Fred Okang’o, former Nairobi County Deputy Governor Jonathan Mueke and Kandara member of parliament Alice Wahome.

Wandayi claimed that according to the constitution, it is expressly written that the Deputy President is the principal assistant of the president, and he or she is expected to perform those roles that will be designated to him or her by the president. By virtue of this, Wandayi declared that a Deputy President, is under no circumstances expected to hold an opinion contrary to that of the president.

This is regardless of whether or not his position may be deemed morally upright or sensibly superior compared to that of the president.

Since their stunning fallout, Deputy President William Ruto has consistently faced accusations of not only being disrespectful to the president but also disloyal. He, however, alongside his allies, has always denied this.

In Chapter Nine of the Kenyan constitution titled The Executive, the functions of the Deputy President are titled as such;
(1) The Deputy President shall be the principal assistant of the President and shall deputise for the President in the execution of the President’s functions.
(2) The Deputy President shall perform the functions conferred by this Constitution and any other functions of the President as the President may assign.
(3) Subject to Article 134, when the President is absent or is temporarily incapacitated, and during any other period that the President decides, the Deputy President shall act as the President.
(4) The Deputy President shall not hold any other State or public office.

headline: Accused “Social Climber” Anne Kiguta celebrates after mention from former British First Lady
author: Joshua Wanga

breadcrumbs.name: Accused “Social Climber” Anne Kiguta celebrates after mention from former British First Lady

description: Former top TV presenter and news anchor Anne Kiguta who has constantly faced accusations of being a social climber following her alleged romantic affair with the president’s nephew Jomo Gecaga was ecstatic after getting a mention from none other than Cherie Blair. Kiguta has in the past been accused of pandering to high society especially
articleBody:
Total Views : 232

Former top TV presenter and news anchor Anne Kiguta who has constantly faced accusations of being a social climber following her alleged romantic affair with the president’s nephew Jomo Gecaga was ecstatic after getting a mention from none other than Cherie Blair. Kiguta has in the past been accused of pandering to high society especially when she worked for Kirubi at Capital FM and the Kenyattas at K24.

Kiguta, who has previously worked for the Standard Group and Royal Media Services as well, was the moderator in a panel that was convened by Cherie Blair’s foundation. After the talk, the foundation posted a tweet to thank all those who made the talk possible, and also took special notice for Anne Kiguta who they described as an amazing moderator.

Clearly impressed and ecstatic about this, Kiguta quickly retweeted their post, thanking them too for an incredible experience. Her tweet read,
Anne Kiguta
@AnneKiguta
One of the best panels I have ever had the pleasure to be with. Thanks to these incredible women & @CherieBlairFndn for bringing us together.

The tweet by the Cherie Blair foundation read,

Cherie Blair Foundation for Women
@CherieBlairFndn
Did you miss our panel discussion ‘The Media Taking a Lead’ with @BloombergLive’s @ThisisMallika, @un_stereotype’s @mitchyov & @FeminismInIndia’s Japleen Pasricha? The panel was moderated by the amazing @AnneKiguta.

The Cherie Blair Foundation for Women helps release the potential of women entrepreneurs in low and middle income countries, and close the global gender gap in entrepreneurship.
Since the Foundation’s inception in 2008, it has directly supported over 175,000 women across more than 100 countries.

Through its combined approach of programmatic delivery and advocacy, the Foundation supports women to start and grow successful micro, small and medium businesses, with training, technology, mentoring and networking at the heart of its work. This opens doors to finance, markets, contacts and more, and empowers women to create better futures for themselves and their families, enable their communities to prosper, contribute to strong economies, and move the world in a whole new direction.

When women entrepreneurs have the support and opportunities to thrive, the future is transformed.

headline: Ngunjiri Publicly Spills The Beans As He Reveals The Worst Thing That Will Bring Raila Odinga down
author: Paul nyongesa

breadcrumbs.name: Ngunjiri Publicly Spills The Beans As He Reveals The Worst Thing That Will Bring Raila Odinga down

description: Bahati Member of Parliament Kimani Ngunjiri has cautioned ODM leader Raila Odinga over his relationship with President Uhuru Kenyatta ahead of 2022 polls. Speaking to a local TV station on Tuesday night, the vocal lawmaker alleged that Raila Odinga can be a good leader, but the people surrounding him are Corrupt and dishonest to themselves.
articleBody:
Total Views : 76

Bahati Member of Parliament Kimani Ngunjiri has cautioned ODM leader Raila Odinga over his relationship with President Uhuru Kenyatta ahead of 2022 polls.

Speaking to a local TV station on Tuesday night, the vocal lawmaker alleged that Raila Odinga can be a good leader, but the people surrounding him are Corrupt and dishonest to themselves.

He further asked the ODM supremo to watch Kenyatta’s moves, because he is a kind of a leader who has been associated with illegal Affairs within and outside the Government

“….. If Raila Odinga thinks that everything is good on his Side, then I want to Say Sorry to him. Because the who are Currently Surrounding him, are the most ‘sinful’ people in the Government. They have been Associated with looting of Resources.”

“…… And just to make my point straight and understandable. President Uhuru Kenyatta could be the main reason why Raila might lose the Presidency. Let Raila Odinga learn from History.” Narrator Bahati Legislature Hon Onesmus Kimani Ngunjiri.

Raila having declared his bid, He will face a tough fight against his new and much younger rival, Kenya’s Deputy President William Ruto, who was previously promised Kenyatta’s backing for the top job in exchange for his support.

Ruto, 54, has positioned himself as a leader looking to upend the status quo and stand up for the “hustlers” trying to make ends meet in a country ruled by “dynasties”.

The Kenyatta and Odinga families have dominated Kenyan politics since independence in 1963.

In an interview with AFP in September, Odinga said he was confident of his ability to win over voters.

“I have a track record which Kenyans understand very well,” he said.

“They know that given an opportunity as the head of government, I can introduce a lot of changes.”

headline: Former wiper insider and Kalonzo loyalist reveals what Kalonzo plans to do on January 15th
author: Joshua Wanga

breadcrumbs.name: Former wiper insider and Kalonzo loyalist reveals what Kalonzo plans to do on January 15th

description: A former member of the Wiper Democratic Movement party, and previously close associate of the Wiper party leader Kalonzo Musyoka is now making claims about his former boss, and allegations about what he is silently planning on doing come January 15th, next year. Former Nairobi county Deputy Governor Jonathan Mueke who served under Evans Kidero
articleBody:
Total Views : 517

A former member of the Wiper Democratic Movement party, and previously close associate of the Wiper party leader Kalonzo Musyoka is now making claims about his former boss, and allegations about what he is silently planning on doing come January 15th, next year.

Former Nairobi county Deputy Governor Jonathan Mueke who served under Evans Kidero as part of an ODM-Wiper Party working arrangement was speaking while appearing on Citizen TV’s Daybreak which was hosted by Sam Gituku. Alongside Mueke in the studio was political analyst Fred Okang’o and Kandara member of parliament, Alice Wahome.

Jonathan Mueke asserted that there are only two serious presidential candidates in the country, namely Raila Odinga and Deputy President William Ruto. He dismissed the others as “not serious” .
Upon increased prodding from his host Sam Gituku about whether he really meant it when he said his former party leader was not a serious candidate, he doubled down on his earlier remarks. He reiterated that Kalonzo isn’t a serious contender, and quoted the recently conducted opinion poll by Radio Africa which showed that the Wiper party leader not only polled at less than two percent, but Ruto performed better than him in his own Kamba-land backyard.

He then went ahead to further claim that as a matter of fact, Kalonzo, and his co-partners in the One Kenya Alliance outfit, were just looking to improve their bargaining power by buying time, but would be soon joining either Raila Odinga or Deputy President William Ruto.

He asserted that on January 15th, Kalonzo and his colleagues would be joining either the Deputy President or the former Prime Minister, during which they would officially fold OKA and do away with it.

It is still unclear why Mueke picked the date January 15th as the one which the OKA principals would be defecting. It remains uncertain whether it is a date on which he has Intelligence reports pointing towards, or if perhaps he had meant to say April 15th.

According to the Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission calendar, December 9, 2021, will mark the end of fundraising by political aspirants, eight months before the general elections.
Parties will conduct primaries from April 16 to April 22.

The names of candidate who will participate in the primaries will be submitted to the commission by April 9.

The commission will then gazette the names by April 16.

This means April 15th will be the final day for any contestant to be registered as a member of the party he intends to run in during the General Election.

headline: Notorious party rebel refers to Gideon Moi as his party leader in astonishing declaration
author: Joshua Wanga

breadcrumbs.name: Notorious party rebel refers to Gideon Moi as his party leader in astonishing declaration

description: On a day that saw the launch of the Democratic Alliance Party of Kenya DAP-K at the Bomas with Ford Kenya rebels Wafula Wamunyinyi and Eseli Simiyu assuming leadership roles in the new outfit, another rebel from another party was making an equally unexpected announcement. Appearing to have finally given up on his party, the
articleBody:
Total Views : 155

On a day that saw the launch of the Democratic Alliance Party of Kenya DAP-K at the Bomas with Ford Kenya rebels Wafula Wamunyinyi and Eseli Simiyu assuming leadership roles in the new outfit, another rebel from another party was making an equally unexpected announcement. Appearing to have finally given up on his party, the renegade politician is now paying allegiance to KANU Chairman Gideon Moi.

One time defacto leader of the Thirdway Alliance party Fred Okang’o seems to have thrown in the towel in the fierce and protracted battle for the party with its founder and constitutional lawyer Ekuru Aukot. This is after he declared that KANU Chairman Gideon Moi is his party leader.

It was while outlining KANU’s position within the One Kenya Alliance outfit and its relationship with Raila’s Azimio La Umoja movement that he paid homage to the KANU Chairman.

Prior to this, Okang’o had been associated with The Strugglers Movement, a seemingly amorphous unit that declared political neutrality, asserting that it seeks to push for the aspirations of struggling Kenyans.

Political movements and realignments are expected as the country moves towards the 2022 General Election.

Mr Wamunyinyi had last Week hinted at plans to join a new party with which they would join Mr Odinga’s Azimio la Umoja Movement which was launched last Friday.

“We have been with Raila but now I want us to be even closer because he is most qualified to lead this country,” Mr Wamunyinyi said at the Convent Hotel in Nairobi last Week where Mr Odinga was meeting Jubilee and ODM party officials from Nairobi.

The same day, Mr Odinga also met Mr Wamalwa, at Chungwa House where they agreed that the Defence CS would attend last Friday’s Azimio ya Umoja convention in Kasarani.

On Monday, Dr Simiyu said that they will officially announce their 2022 political vehicle at yesterday’s DAP-K meeting.

“When we were leaving Ford Kenya we said we would announce our next move on December 14. Let’s wait for the day tomorrow,” Dr Simiyu said.

Mr Wamalwa, Mr Wamunyinyi and Dr Simiyu had on May 22, 2020 met Mr Odinga, a few days before the Ford Kenya “coup” happened.

headline: Wajakoya brags how he refused to meet Raila and ordered him to instead come to his office
author: Joshua Wanga

breadcrumbs.name: Wajakoya brags how he refused to meet Raila and ordered him to instead come to his office

description: Roots Party of Kenya boss Professor George Wajakoya is now training his guns on the Orange Democratic Movement party leader Raila Odinga. This is after his September scathing attack on Deputy President William Ruto's Bottom-up approach while popularising his Roots party in West Pokot. Wajakoya whose party slogan is “Tingiza Miti” has been the target
articleBody:
Total Views : 185

Roots Party of Kenya boss Professor George Wajakoya is now training his guns on the Orange Democratic Movement party leader Raila Odinga. This is after his September scathing attack on Deputy President William Ruto’s Bottom-up approach while popularising his Roots party in West Pokot. Wajakoya whose party slogan is “Tingiza Miti” has been the target of childish and immature jokes by a section of bad-mannered Kenyans who have coined lewd and vulgar jokes using his slogan. This, however, has not deterred the scholar who will be graduating with an eighth degree this week at The University of Nairobi.

Wajakoya was speaking while appearing on K24’s Punchline which was hosted by the station’s presenter Alan Abinadab Owino. Alongside the Roots Party of Kenya boss in the studio was Mvita member of parliament and ODM member Abdulswamad Nassir. Also in on the action was Bahati MP Kimani Ngunjiri.

Wajakoya, while outlining the ambitions and ideals of his party, revealed that an operative from former Prime Minister Raila Odinga’s camp had been sent to him. The said operative approached him promising to arrange a meeting between him and Raila Odinga.

Wajakoya, however, says that he asked the former PM’s man whether the meeting would be on an equal basis with two presidential contenders discussing issues on a platform of equality, or if he would be kept waiting in a room for hours before finally being allowed a few minutes with him. He wondered whether all this was for a photo-op where he would be then photographed with Raila under a misleading headline.

He claimed that having made known all these concerns, he sent away the Raila representative with a message that he would only meet Raila Odinga if it would be him coming to his office, and not he going to Raila’s office.

Earlier in September, the presidential aspirant in his campaigns in Chepkobegh, slammed the bottom-up economy saying that the model steals money from the taxpayers.
He said he targets to empower the marginalized community who have high poverty levels by conducting funds drives that will help women groups to start commercial businesses.

He claimed that having made known all these concerns, he sent away the Raila representative with a message that he would only meet Raila Odinga if it would be him coming to his office, and not he going to Raila’s office.


Earlier in September, the presidential aspirant in his campaigns in Chepkobegh, slammed the bottom-up economy saying that the model steals money from the taxpayers.
He said he targets to empower the marginalized community who have high poverty levels by conducting funds drives that will help women groups to start commercial businesses.

headline: Residents Left In Dismay After Four Men Force Themselves On Another Man In The Bush
author: Paul nyongesa

breadcrumbs.name: Residents Left In Dismay After Four Men Force Themselves On Another Man In The Bush

description: 41-year-old man was last evening rushed to a Murang’a hospital in serious condition, after he was sodomised by four young men. In the bizarre incident that left villagers of Githiagara in Kugumo, Murang’a county in shock, the man was walking home from imbibing frothy waters with elders, when he was approached by the four, at
articleBody:
Total Views : 216

41-year-old man was last evening rushed to a Murang’a hospital in serious condition, after he was sodomised by four young men.

In the bizarre incident that left villagers of Githiagara in Kugumo, Murang’a county in shock, the man was walking home from imbibing frothy waters with elders, when he was approached by the four, at around 1am.

They immediately dragged him to a secluded area before they wrestled him to the ground and did the despicable act in turns. After the act, they left the man who was walking from Kahethu shopping centre lying on the ground helpless.

Following the beastly incident, two suspects Bernard Kamande, 25 and Erick Kimani, 21 who were positively identified by the victim have been arrested.

They two are currently guests of the state at Muthithi police station, as detectives intensify their search for the rest of the suspects.

headline: Kiraitu says Mt Kenya might not produce a president for the next 20 years
author: George Okello

breadcrumbs.name: Kiraitu says Mt Kenya might not produce a president for the next 20 years

description: Governor Kiraitu Murungi has called on people from the Mt Kenya region to start embracing the fact that the region will not produce a serious presidential contender in the coming elections.
articleBody:
Total Views : 132

DEP party leaders and Meru County Governor Kiraitu Murungi has called on people from the Mt Kenya region to start embracing the fact that the region will not produce a serious presidential contender in the coming elections.

Speaking on Tuesday at a meeting with members of his party, Kiraitu refuted assertions that the Central Kenya alliances before the 2022 general elections would present a suitable presidential candidate noting that their efforts will be futile.

According to the governor, it might take the region up to 20 years to clinch the presidency once more.

“Lakini hio kiti, wakati huu tukubali, we will not get it, minimum ten years or even more years; could even be 20 years,” Kiraitu said.

Kiraitu also belittled National Assembly Speaker Justin Muturi’s presidential ambitions claiming that he doesn’t stand a chance to win the seat.

“There will be no president coming from Mount Kenya region and am sorry to say even my friend JB, amejaribu sana lakini ata sioni akiingia,” Kiraitu stated.

He noted that the only position the region can secure once President Uhuru Kenyatta retires in 2022 is government positions.

The governor, therefore, urged the leaders from the region to focus on other things and squash their dreams to clinch the country’s top seat.

headline: Aubameyang stripped of Arsenal captaincy
author: Ericson Mangoli
description: Arsenal have stripped Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang of the club captaincy after his "latest disciplinary breach".
articleBody:
71

Arsenal have stripped Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang of the club captaincy after his “latest disciplinary breach”.

The Gabon striker, who was dropped for Saturday’s 3-0 Premier League win over Southampton, will not be considered for Wednesday’s game against West Ham.

“We expect all our players, particularly our captain, to work to the rules and standards we have all set and agreed,” read an Arsenal statement.

Aubameyang, 32, was also dropped for disciplinary reasons in March.

On that occasion, he missed the win over rivals Tottenham for a “breach of pre-match protocol”.

This time Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta has not disclosed how Aubameyang broke the rules, but The Athletic reported that he returned late from an authorised trip abroad.

“We have been very consistent, that we have certain non-negotiables in the team that we have set ourselves as a club,” said Arteta after the Southampton match.

“Whatever happens in the dressing room, I cannot share. From my side, I will never say what the breach was.”

Aubameyang took over as captain in November 2019 after midfielder Granit Xhaka was relieved of the job by then-boss Unai Emery.

Aubameyang, who joined Arsenal for £56m from Borussia Dortmund in 2018, signed a new three-year contract last year.

This season he has scored only four goals in 14 league games and none since 22 October.

Arsenal are sixth in the table, 12 points behind leaders Manchester City.

Analysis

This is very a big call from Arteta. He has always talked of “non-negotiables” and he must feel Aubameyang has crossed the line turning up late twice in a year.

Last Thursday Arteta said there was no desire to sell Aubameyang in January: “We have never discussed something like this. When players are having difficult periods what we have to give is support.”

Since then, Aubameyang has been stripped of the captaincy and dropped from two Premier League matches. Having lost the captaincy and his place in the starting XI, there’s every chance Aubameyang might want to leave and Arteta will not stand in his way next month.

As for replacements, Alexandre Lacazette will probably be captain against West Ham. Xhaka is a leader at the club but I’m not sure that would go down well with the Arsenal fans after he was stripped of the captaincy. Kieran Tierney and Gabriel would be the fans’ favourites.

headline: Man United’s match at Brentford postponed due to Covid
author: Ericson Mangoli

breadcrumbs.name: Man United’s match at Brentford postponed due to Covid

description: Manchester United's Premier League fixture away to Brentford on Tuesday night has been postponed due to a Covid outbreak among the visitors' squad.
articleBody:
Total Views : 50

Manchester United’s Premier League fixture away to Brentford on Tuesday night has been postponed due to a Covid outbreak among the visitors’ squad.

United made a request to the Premier League to postpone the fixture after being forced to close first-team operations at their Carrington training complex on Monday afternoon.

The club said they recorded a “small number” of positive Covid cases among first-team players and staff who took lateral flow tests on Sunday, a day after they beat Norwich 1-0 at Carrow Road.

Those positive results were confirmed after PCR tests were undertaken on Monday, and those who have the virus are currently isolating.

Man Utd’s upcoming fixtures

A statement from United on Monday night read: “Given the cancellation of training and disruption to the squad, and with the health of players and staff the priority, the club requested the match to be rearranged.

“The Premier League board took the decision to postpone based on guidance from medical advisors.

“Manchester United regrets the inconvenience caused to Brentford FC and to the fans of both clubs by Covid-19.”

There's no any case that
articleBody:

Beleaguered FKF president Nick Mwendwa isn’t off the hook yet as it’s being purported by online bloggers.

The file closed is the application for him to be detained (14) days as authorities continue with investigations and come up with desired charges against the economic crimes he will be liable for.

There’s no any case that has been closed, since there’s isn’t any criminal case file that has been opened against him. Since investigations are still ongoing.

After completion of the investigation and charges levelled against him. (Criminal case file shall be available) He shall be arrested and presented to court charged then present his defence on the said charges.

Nothing changes earlier court orders of baring him from Kandanda House & involvement in soccer activities remain in force. That’s why he (Nick Mwendwa) has applied petition for the court to bring back FKF to control soccer procedddings to disregard CS Amina gazetted caretaker committee. A decision which is I’ll adviced.

The embattled president should be awake the legal battle and arrests that are in yonder, ain’t a child’s play.

headline: Football won’t wait for Kenya
author: Pauline Nabwire
description: A FIFA ban on Kenyan football may kill the careers of players and referees says Dickson Doyo, FKF Secretary General for Nairobi East. The grassroots football official calls for a wider perspective on the current impasse in Kenyan football. “A ban will affect everyone in the game: players won’t be able to move, referees won’t
articleBody:
Total Views : 341

A FIFA ban on Kenyan football may kill the careers of players and referees says Dickson Doyo, FKF Secretary General for Nairobi East.

The grassroots football official calls for a wider perspective on the current impasse in Kenyan football.

“A ban will affect everyone in the game: players won’t be able to move, referees won’t be able to take international assessments, and even coaches especially the instructors will also be affected but there is a bigger issue to consider,” Doyo warned.

“Football is a game that is based on time; there is a peak period for every role in the sport. Whether you are a player or a referee, you have a peak. If you don’t get that opportunity at your peak because of a FIFA ban-that will probably be the end of you in football.”

Doyo insists those welcoming a ban are not seeing the full picture because the game will not wait for Kenyans.

“A ban means taking life changing opportunities from people who have waited their whole lives for their moment.There are other solutions out there we just need to have the will to find. We do not have to tear down the game.”

Doyo is also worried about the precedent being set for football in the country.

“What will happen every time a government minister has differences with an elected Federation official? Will this be our normal? It cannot be. We need proper systems and procedures to ensure the game is not held hostage to political differences”

Doyo’s parting short is on grassroots football.
“This situation hurts grassroots football. It sows confusion and it gets even worse when we 800 million shillings’ budgets with nothing for grassroots football.’

A few weeks ago, Sports Cabinet Secretary Amina Mohamed installed a committee led by Aaron Ringera to replace the FKF office led by Nick Mwendwa.

The new committee was mandated among other things, to run football activities in the country for the next six months before organizing elections to usher in a new office.

However, the move by the government was not received well by Fifa, who warned they will take tough sanctions against the country, including an indefinite ban from all football activities if the decision to appoint the Ringera-led committee is not rescinded.

headline: Sports action resumes on FKF PL this weekend amidst financial crunch
author: Pauline Nabwire

breadcrumbs.name: Sports action resumes on FKF PL this weekend amidst financial crunch

description: Football Kenya Federation caretaker committee has released the Kenyan premier league and national super league fixtures. Despite the released fixtures, Uncertainty has gripped the resumption of the 2021/2022 Football Kenya Federation (FKF) Premier League season after clubs asked the government for Sh2 million in grants as a condition to resume games. The top-flight league has
articleBody:
Total Views : 387

Football Kenya Federation caretaker committee has released the Kenyan premier league and national super league fixtures.

Despite the released fixtures, Uncertainty has gripped the resumption of the 2021/2022 Football Kenya Federation (FKF) Premier League season after clubs asked the government for Sh2 million in grants as a condition to resume games.

The top-flight league has been on a three-week recess ever since Sports Cabinet Secretary Amina Mohamed announced she’d disbanded the federation and set up a 26-man caretaker committee that includes an 11-member secretariat to run football affairs in the interim.

According to the Kenyan Premier league fixtures Kariobangi Sharks will face Nairobi City Stars this Saturday December 4th 2021 at Ruaraka Grounds while Bidco United will square it out with AFC Leopards at Thika Stadium.

Nzoia Sugar will welcome Kakamega Homeboyz at Sudi Stadium with Ulinzi facing Wazito at Kasarani Stadium.

Mathare United will play newly promoted FC Talanta at Kasarani while Kenya Police will be up against 2009 champions Sofapaka.

On Sunday, only one fixture is scheduled last season’s first runner up KCB FC will play Vihiga Bullets.

The League before its halt had seen five rounds into the new 2021/22 season.

headline: DCI unhappy with NIck Mwendwa’s case
author: Paul nyongesa

breadcrumbs.name: DCI unhappy with NIck Mwendwa’s case

description: Directorate of Criminal (DCI) officers are reportedly unhappy with the way the case against Football Kenya Federation (FKF) President Nick Mwendwa is being handled. The officers feel like they are caught in the middle of a war between a higher power and the FKF President. For example when Nick Mwendwa was re-arrested on Friday the
articleBody:
Total Views : 1,032

Directorate of Criminal (DCI) officers are reportedly unhappy with the way the case against Football Kenya Federation (FKF) President Nick Mwendwa is being handled.

The officers feel like they are caught in the middle of a war between a higher power and the FKF President.

For example when Nick Mwendwa was re-arrested on Friday the 26th of November, the investigating officers on the case had no idea what was happening. They thought the matter had ended a day earlier with the DPP choosing not to prefer charges against Mwendwa.

Our source tells one investigator had almost reached his rural home 400Km away before he was summoned to return.

Apparently the higher power was unhappy with the loss and ordered Mwendwa re-arrested and charged.

The officers reportedly feel their professionalism is being dragged through the mud and that their department will come out the laughing stock in the whole affair.

headline: Mwendwa arrest in bad faith
author: Paul nyongesa
description: Nick Mwendwa’s arrest on Friday was in done in bad faith and is unconstitutional his lawyers told the court before securing his release on a cash bail of 4 million shillings. Mwendwa’s lawyers who included Mutula Kilonzo Jnr, Tom Ojienda, Erik Mutua, Nelson Havi and Johh Khaminwa were opposing the prosecution request to keep Mwendwa
articleBody:
Total Views : 368

Nick Mwendwa’s arrest on Friday was in done in bad faith and is unconstitutional his lawyers told the court before securing his release on a cash bail of 4 million shillings.

Mwendwa’s lawyers who included Mutula Kilonzo Jnr, Tom Ojienda, Erik Mutua, Nelson Havi and Johh Khaminwa were opposing the prosecution request to keep Mwendwa for an extra 14 days.

The prosecution argued they needed more time to interview witnesses and collect documents.

Lawyer Erick Mutua dismissed this argument saying the investigation was based on the report of a fourteen day inspection which was released on the 5th meaning the State had an extra 10 days to carry out any additional investigation.

They also argued that by putting in place a caretaker committee the CS had already taken over FKF and therefore the issue of Mwendwa’s influence does not arise.

The lawyers so took issue with the report of the inspection Committee.

The report talks about 500 million but the DCI are only looking at 29.5 and 8.5 that is bad faith,” Mutua argued.

Ojienda argued Mwendwa was being held illegally.

“What is the charge? They don’t even know and they want to hold our client.”

headline: FKF disbandment is permanent, Amina tells Fifa
author: Pauline Nabwire

breadcrumbs.name: FKF disbandment is permanent, Amina tells Fifa

description: Sports Cabinet Secretary Amina Mohamed asserted that the decision to disband the Football Kenya Federation (FKF) will not change. In a virtual meeting with Fifa Secretary General Fatma Samoura Wednesday, CS Amina maintained that the move to form a caretaker committee led by Retired Judge Aaron Ringera to run football activities in Kenya for the
articleBody:
Total Views : 466

Sports Cabinet Secretary Amina Mohamed asserted that the decision to disband the Football Kenya Federation (FKF) will not change.

In a virtual meeting with Fifa Secretary General Fatma Samoura Wednesday, CS Amina maintained that the move to form a caretaker committee led by Retired Judge Aaron Ringera to run football activities in Kenya for the next six months, will remain intact.

Another meeting is scheduled for next week.

On Monday, FIFA threatened to impose a ban on Kenya in the wake of reported government interference in the management of football in the country.

In a letter addressed to sports Cabinet Secretary Amina Mohammad, FIFA Secretary general Fatma Samoura said Amina’s move to install a caretaker committee to run the Football Kenya Federation is illegal.

“I have been made aware of the appointment of a so-called caretaker committee together with its secretariat in lieu of the FKF NEC. I must highlight this appointment is contrary to our principals in which all our members association are supported to independently manage their affairs. The situation could therefore lead to a ban of FKF by FIFA,” said Samoura.

Samoura,s letter came few days after FIFA, in a separate correspondence by Kenny Jean Marie, who is the head of Football Association, expressed concerns over the move by Kenya Sports CS to diband FKF and install a caretaker committee.

headline: Rashid Echesa comes out gun blazing against the arrest of Nick Mwendwa, exposes goverment deals
author: Pauline Nabwire

breadcrumbs.name: Rashid Echesa comes out gun blazing against the arrest of Nick Mwendwa, exposes goverment deals

description: Former Sports Cabinet Secretary Rashid Echesa has come out gun blazing against the arrest of Football Kenya Federation  boss Nick Mwendwa. Mwendwa was arrested on Friday evening at the Golden Tulip Hotel in Westlands, Nairobi, where he was meeting Harambee Stars players ahead of the Kenya- Rwanda World Cup qualifiers match on Monday, November 15.
articleBody:
Total Views : 1,002

Former Sports Cabinet Secretary Rashid Echesa has come out gun blazing against the arrest of Football Kenya Federation boss Nick Mwendwa.

Mwendwa was arrested on Friday evening at the Golden Tulip Hotel in Westlands, Nairobi, where he was meeting Harambee Stars players ahead of the Kenya- Rwanda World Cup qualifiers match on Monday, November 15.

He was taken to the DCI headquaters where he was questioned on how FKF spent Sh 480 million advanced to them from 2016 by the sports, Arts and Social development for running football activities.

He was also grilled on Sh244 million, an amount given to the federation to prepare Harambee Stars for the 2011 African Cup of

Speaking hour later after his arrest, Rashid Echesa said that the arrest of Nick Mwendwa was illegal and that it showed how the government has not taken sports seriously to tell the FKF boss to account for money in the docket.

articleBodyHtml:
Total Views : 1,002

Former Sports Cabinet Secretary Rashid Echesa has come out gun blazing against the arrest of Football Kenya Federation  boss Nick Mwendwa.

Mwendwa was arrested on Friday evening at the Golden Tulip Hotel in Westlands, Nairobi, where he was meeting Harambee Stars players ahead of the Kenya- Rwanda World Cup qualifiers match on Monday, November 15.

He was taken to the DCI headquaters where he was questioned on how FKF spent Sh 480 million advanced to them from 2016 by the sports, Arts and Social development for running football activities.

He was also grilled on Sh244 million, an amount given to the federation to prepare Harambee Stars for the 2011 African Cup of

Mwendwa has been detained at Gigiri Police station for further grilling which will continue today.

headline: Reinstate FKf officials, FIFA tells Amina
author: Paul nyongesa

breadcrumbs.name: Reinstate FKf officials, FIFA tells Amina

description: FIfA has for the second time in as many days threaten to impose a ban on Kenya in the wake of reported government  interference in the management of football in the country. In a letter addressed to sports Cabinet Secretary Amina Mohammad, FIFA Secretary general Fatma Samoura said Amina's move to install a caretaker committee
articleBody:
Total Views : 518

FIfA has for the second time in as many days threaten to impose a ban on Kenya in the wake of reported government interference in the management of football in the country.

In a letter addressed to sports Cabinet Secretary Amina Mohammad, FIFA Secretary general Fatma Samoura said Amina’s move to install a caretaker committee to run the Football Kenya Federation is illegal.

“I have been made aware of the appointment of a so-called caretaker committee together with its secretariat in lieu of the FKF NEC. I must highlight this appointment is contrary to our principals in which all our members association are supported to independently manage their affairs. The situation could therefore lead to a ban of FKF by FIFA,” said Samoura.

Fatma also extended an olive branch, promising immediate negotiation in a bid to resolve the crisis.

“FIFA understand the important role your office plays in ensuring that sport bodies in Kenya comply with applicable rules,” she added.

Samoura,s letter comes two days after FIFA, in a separate correspondence by Kenny Jean Marie, who is the head of Football Association, expressed concerns over the move by Kenya Sports CS to diband FKF and install a caretaker committee.

headline: Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk named Person of the Year
author: Ericson Mangoli

breadcrumbs.name: Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk named Person of the Year

description: Time magazine has named Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk as its Person of the Year, for an incredible 12 months of achievements in which he jockeyed for the crown of world’s richest person.
articleBody:
Total Views : 95

Time magazine has named Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk as its Person of the Year, for an incredible 12 months of achievements in which he jockeyed for the crown of world’s richest person and made his Twitter account a must-read while moving the needle on climate change, cryptocurrencies, space exploration, and universal broadband.

In April, NASA granted Musk’s rocket company SpaceX an exclusive contract to put United States astronauts on the moon for the first time since 1972 – moving Musk one step ahead of rival old-guard rocket firm Boeing and one step closer to his stated goal of helping to make humans a multi-planetary species.

In May, Musk hosted Saturday Night Live, using the television show as a platform to poke fun at himself and to raise awareness of Asperger syndrome, a mild form of autism, by announcing that he has it.

In October, Musk’s growing wealth received yet another turbo-charged after car-rental company Hertz said it planned to buy 100,000 Teslas for its customers. The news sent Tesla stock soaring and the electric vehicle company’s valuation past $1 trillion.

Though electric vehicles comprised just 0.43 percent of all vehicles in operation in the US in the first half of this year, Tesla commanded roughly two-thirds of that market, according to Experian Automotive.

All those milestones did not quell Musk’s quirky (and sometimes costly) behaviour. He regularly shares humorous memes with his 65 million followers on Twitter. Last month, Tesla shares took a knock after Musk asked in a Twitter poll whether he should sell his Tesla stock, which he has to the sum of nearly $11bn dollars, according to the US Securities and Exchange Commission.

He’s also used Twitter as a platform to help move cryptocurrencies more into the mainstream. In February, Musk announced that Tesla had bought $1.5bn in Bitcoin and signalled its intent to start accepting it as payment. He also extolled Dogecoin through a series of memes that helped transform the once-joke cryptocurrency into a sought-after digital asset.

But he also showed the limits of his crypto boosterism, tweeting in May that Tesla would suspend accepting payments in Bitcoin and citing concerns over the cryptocurrency’s carbon footprint.

Not just dollars and memes

The about-face on Bitcoin lent more credibility to Musk’s loftier stated aims to curb climate change.

“Had the 800,000 Teslas sold in the last year been gas-powered cars, they would have emitted more than 40 million metric tons of CO₂ over their lifetimes—equivalent to the annual emissions of Finland,” Time magazine wrote in its profile of Musk.

But curbing emissions is just a part of his grand vision for humanity. Musk also wants people to start colonising Mars.

“The goal overall has been to make life multi-planetary and enable humanity to become a spacefaring civilization,” Musk told Time.

When asked by Time about the timeline for sending people to Mars and refueling on the Red Planet to come back to Earth, Musk responded: “I’ll be surprised if we’re not landing on Mars within five years.”

Back here on Earth, Musk is working to close the digital divide with Starlink, a satellite broadband service with nearly 2,000 launched satellites to date. He hopes to launch as many as 42,000 more to provide internet service to underserved developing and rural communities around the globe.

Musk is also in talks with Brazil’s government on how Starlink’s satellites can help combat the Amazon’s deforestation and forest fires. And he’s taking steps to provide internet services to rural India.

But things are not all starry-eyed for the billionaire. Some former employees have accused his companies of fostering an environment where sexual harassment, poor working conditions, and racism are prevalent. Earlier this year, a federal jury ordered Tesla to fork over $137m to an African American former employee at the EV maker’s factory in Freemont, California, who said that Tesla turned a blind eye to racial abuse.

Tesla has been fined for regulatory violations. And the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration is looking into the safety of Tesla’s Autopilot software after a complaint implicated it in a crash.

Musk’s Midas touch and expanding net worth have also landed him in the inequality crosshairs and the debate over whether the government should force the rich to pay more taxes.

“A lot of the push for higher government involvement and expropriating of assets by the government is pushed by a bunch of politicians who are actually saying that resources in the control of private individuals should be in control of the government. They are basically saying that they want control of the assets,” Musk told Time magazine in an interview.

Born in Pretoria, South Africa, Musk moved to the US to attend Stanford University as a Ph.D. candidate but dropped out. He co-founded internet mapping service Zip2 and e-payment company PayPal, which were then sold to Compaq and eBay, respectively.

headline: Why Your Business Needs a Website
author: Brainverse Tech Bytes

breadcrumbs.name: Why Your Business Needs a Website

description: A website is a very important tool in building your business’s online presence. Especially in this day and age, clients will most likely visit your website before they make a purchase. Of course, the quality of the website matters. In this article, we will highlight the reasons why your business needs a website. Most businesses
articleBody:
A website is a very important tool in building your business’s online presence. Especially in this day and age, clients will most likely visit your website before they make a purchase.

Of course, the quality of the website matters. In this article, we will highlight the reasons why your business needs a website.

Most businesses don’t have websites because they don’t feel tech-savvy enough to manage the website and also because of cost concerns.

Build your credibility

Chances are that several providers are offering the same service as you. Having a simple website that looks good and clearly communicates to your customers will make you stand out.

Having a website will create a good first impression and build a customer’s confidence in your service quality.

Leads

Having a business website can boost your sales because once people find you, become interested in your product or service, they will want to contact you.

With the contact information you leave on the website, you will get more leads and your numbers will go up.

Build your brand

As a business, you need to showcase your brand to your prospective customers. With your business website, you can clearly communicate who you are, what you represent, and what you stand for.

Without a website, it would be difficult to do this because potential customers would not have a reliable source of information on credible details about your business.

Time-saving and improved customer service

Most of the calls you receive from clients are to ask about the working hours or location. With a website, all this information will be made available to them.

With a reduction in the number of calls from clients, employees can focus on other important things. Clients also don’t have to go through the hustle of calling to get simple information, ultimately leading to a better user experience.

Conclusion

To put everything into perspective, research conducted found that 85% of people research a business or service before making a purchase.

If you’re going to do one thing today to improve your business, it is to get a website. Visit Brainverse Technologies and get your business’ website up and running as soon as possible.

headline: Chatbots, A New Technology for Your Business Today
author: Brainverse Tech Bytes

breadcrumbs.name: Chatbots, A New Technology for Your Business Today

description: Apparently, one of the robust challenges affecting business organizations that have consistently hampered their abilities to perform effectively is balancing the demands of uniqueness and effectiveness. Often, the reason why some organizations are unable to balance the two rests in their inability to embrace technology, in a manner capable of addressing business needs today. “Chatbots”
articleBody:
Total Views : 742

Apparently, one of the robust challenges affecting business organizations that have consistently hampered their abilities to perform effectively is balancing the demands of uniqueness and effectiveness. Often, the reason why some organizations are unable to balance the two rests in their inability to embrace technology, in a manner capable of addressing business needs today. “ Chatbots ” the fast revolution in technology today cannot be underestimated, as statistics from Spiceworks state that 62% of businesses in the world today are adapting to new technologies.

What is a Chatbot?

In simple terms, a chatbot is computer software that simulates human conversation through voice commands or text chats, or both. There are a number of Chatbots that we mainly interact with on daily basis. A good example is a floating icon on the bottom right or right-hand side of your screen when you visit a website. Another example is Zuri from Safaricom and Sheila from Brainverse.

Importance of a Chatbot

The primary goal of any marketing strategy is always to attract the consumers towards a given product, so as to escalate the sales volume of that product. A Chatbot has mainly shortened your life span as a company to reach your desired goals.

Below is the significance of a Chatbot

1. Cost saving

Let’s do the maths together. Imagine having to travel to and from the city center in Nairobi, just to consult on a fault on a product that you purchased. Ultimately, you have incurred transportation costs you had not planned for. What if you had an online link and you could use it to interact with your dealer in a blink of an eye? Chatbots are mainly built-in line with Artificial Intelligence and humanized which allows you to interact with your dealer via text conversations.

2. Interacts with multiple users

Unlike humans, chatbots are programmed to mainly interact with the client, and with this capability, a chatbot can multitask. This allows you to reach more clients at a time. Another significance is the user, who can also interact with different Chatbots at a time. Very few studies have explored the influence of such promotional tools I.e., Chatbots are flyers to your client’s decision to purchase your services.

3. Available 24/7

As competition is very stiff, any business willing to succeed in this turbulent environment should seek to be available 24/7. Remember in any organization, strategy is critical to the success of the organization. Implement a chatbot for your business today by visiting Brainverse Technologies’ home page. Let us help you go online.

Technicality

The significance of a Chatbot in a business is justified. In computational view, a chatbot is an Artificial Intelligence software programmed in three critical stages ranging from the conceptual view, analyzing, and construction of the Chatbot.

The main significance of Artificial Intelligence is that it allows you to interact in your native languages I.e., Sheng by Sheila and Swahili by Zuri. The best part is that experts have a way of programming Bots within given parameters of queries. Thus, answering any question posed to them.

Main functions of Chatbot

1. Gives feedback to the service provider.

2. Acts as a customer’s help desk.

3. Offers the client’s view of different products offered.

4. Creates intimacy between the client and the service provider.

5. Gives you a competitive advantage, as marketing is done for you on online platforms.

Conclusively, it is of great importance to understand how a chatbot plays a critical role in the success of a company. One of the limitations of Chatbots is communicating during complex scenarios. I.e a chatbot may not understand you based on its program. Nonetheless, it is a great tool for your organizational success. author: Brainverse Tech Bytes

Digital positioning is based on what you know about your customer. To stand out, you need to connect with your target audience, stay
articleBody:
Total Views : 678

Just from the title, you probably already have an idea about what we will be tackling in this article.

As a business, you want your brand to stand out from the rest. Digital positioning is based on what you know about your customer. To stand out, you need to connect with your target audience, stay focused and remain relevant. Below are a few steps you can implement to brand your business online and stand out from your competitors:

Know your value

In order to stand out from others in the market, you have to find out where exactly your business comes in. What service or product are you providing for your clients that they cannot find elsewhere?

Create relevant and thought-provoking websites

Depending on the quality of your business’ website, you can turn a potential lead into a hot lead. Your website should give insight on the services you provide. Valuable content on your website will drive more users to your website, improve credibility and make you stand out online.

Keywords

Keywords will come in handy when potential clients will be searching for your services online. Your use of keywords will enable search engine optimization which will drive the target audience to your website.

Know where to find your target audience.

There are numerous socializing platforms like Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc. If you find out that your target audience is mainly found on Twitter, then THE majority of your efforts should go towards interacting on Twitter.

Share valuable content.

Websites that receive more traffic are those where the content is being improved. It does not stop at creating a good website but going further to constantly improve your website. Your audience would like to learn something new every time they visit your website. The content should be directed towards your target audience.

In conclusion, digital positioning means good profit and marketability of your business. Head over to Brainverse Technologies to learn how your business will be made to stand out online using business digital positioning.

As a business, you want your brand to stand out from the rest. Digital positioning is based on what you know about your customer. To stand out, you need to connect with your target audience, stay focused and remain relevant. Below are a few steps you can implement to brand your business online and stand out from your competitors:

Know your value

In order to stand out from others in the market, you have to find out where exactly your business comes in. What service or product are you providing for your clients that they cannot find elsewhere?

Create relevant and thought-provoking websites

Depending on the quality of your business’ website, you can turn a potential lead into a hot lead. Your website should give insight on the services you provide. Valuable content on your website will drive more users to your website, improve credibility and make you stand out online.

Keywords

Keywords will come in handy when potential clients will be searching for your services online. Your use of keywords will enable search engine optimization which will drive the target audience to your website.

Know where to find your target audience.

There are numerous socializing platforms like Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc. If you find out that your target audience is mainly found on Twitter, then THE majority of your efforts should go towards interacting on Twitter.

Share valuable content.

Websites that receive more traffic are those where the content is being improved. It does not stop at creating a good website but going further to constantly improve your website. Your audience would like to learn something new every time they visit your website. The content should be directed towards your target audience.

In conclusion, digital positioning means good profit and marketability of your business. Head over to Brainverse Technologies to learn how your business will be made to stand out online using business digital positioning.

In simple terms, brand design describes all the processes done to create a distinctive identity for your product in comparison to other brands.

Key factors when coming up with your brand design

A lot of brainstorming and research by the key stakeholders or members should be done. The Graphics design should be a reflection of the brand’s values and ethics.

The color palette, message, topography, and story should complement the personality of the business and what it offers.

Why is brand design important for your business?

The first reason why Graphics design is at the forefront of the branding process is that it gives you a competitive edge.

The brand should be well planned, designed, and presented to the market in an aesthetic manner. That goes a long way in creating a lasting expression in the minds of consumers.

At the end of the day, your customer is your main brand ambassador. If the brand design is appealing to the customer, then they will be sure to refer the brand to their colleagues, friends, and family.

The Graphics design chosen needs to clearly communicate the goals, objectives, values, and ethos of the company. Therefore, a good Graphics design will communicate all of these in a professional manner.

The Graphics design connects with the customer on an emotional level, giving them a positive attitude towards the brand.

Companies and businesses can hit the highest profit margins or go through the most difficult losses, but Graphic design serves as an intangible asset for the company in the long run.

A good brand design will earn you recognition.

Conclusion

Brand design is at the backbone of marketing and creating a name for your company. During the Graphics design process, it is important to channel the necessary time, resources, and creativity to get the desired results.

headline: MPS Accuse CS Fred Matiang’i of Selfish Interest In the betting firms Licensing
author: Albert

breadcrumbs.name: MPS Accuse CS Fred Matiang’i of Selfish Interest In the betting firms Licensing

description: Members of Parliament from both half, ODM and Jubilee have weighed in on the standoff between betting firms and the Betting Control and Licensing Board claming the government is blackmailing and extorting legally operating businesses. Embakasi Member of Parliament Babu Owino while speaking to members of the press at Serena Hotel said, 'It is clear
articleBody:
Total Views : 328

Members of Parliament from both half, ODM and Jubilee have weighed in on the standoff between betting firms and the Betting Control and Licensing Board claming the government is blackmailing and extorting legally operating businesses.

Embakasi Member of Parliament Babu Owino while speaking to members of the press at Serena Hotel said, “It is clear that this directive is discriminatory & illegal & cannot stand the test of judicial scrutiny. Therefore, we must ask ourselves what is the motive behind this if not the institutional extortion and blackmail of legally operating businesses.

Kakamega senator is on tape saying how the betting industry has helped a great deal in making sure the sporting sector in the country has grown exponentially . The firms have created jobs and if this kind of stand off persists then, the sporting industry.

Honorable Malala went ahead to reveal how top government officials have interests in the betting industry. Claiming CS Matiangi has vested interested of which his close relative is a director at Bet Lion which now has an operating license. Malala said they will fight to the tooth to make sure the firms have their licenses returned. Kakamega youths are huge beneficiaries of the support the betting firms have extended in their previous tournaments such as the CLEO Malalah SUPER CUP

One Keen Kenyan, through his tweeter handle, has paused a question to the government asking how to handle the budget deficit.

There are 3 types of taxes: gaming tax, corporate tax and with holding tax in winnings. Most of the these gaming companies have complied with two taxes. That is the gaming tax and corporate tax. #MPAgainstImpunity

— Bevalyne Kwamboka (@bevalynekwambo3) August 20, 2019

headline: Meet Kenyan Gospel Rapper Arrested Over G4S Money Heist
author: Belindar Momanyi

breadcrumbs.name: Meet Kenyan Gospel Rapper Arrested Over G4S Money Heist

description: Patrick Kagaba alias Kamlesh is an East African christian rapper and poet who is born and raised in Kenya. The rapper was arrested in his garage in Kikuyu in connection to the Nairobi West Money Heist in which 72 million was stolen. The rapper who has not made it to be a house hold name
articleBody:
Total Views : 347

Patrick Kagaba alias Kamlesh is an East African christian rapper and poet who is born and raised in Kenya. The rapper was arrested in his garage in Kikuyu in connection to the Nairobi West Money Heist in which 72 million was stolen.

The rapper who has not made it to be a house hold name among Kenyans is well known among the group of youths he mentors, fellow musicians and clients who frequent his garage.

Those who have interacted with Kamlesh describe him as a devoted christian who preaches water and walks on the path of partaking water. Fellow musicians describe him as a mentor and icon in the music industry.

Kamlesh was arrested alongside two other suspects who were said to be part of the Heist scheme but was released earlier today amid the theft probe.

headline: Revealed! How MPs Were Paid Millions By BAT To Ban Shisha
author: The Kenyan Report

breadcrumbs.name: Revealed! How MPs Were Paid Millions By BAT To Ban Shisha

description: Special Correspondent, December 29, 2019, The Company that is known the world over for not shying away from dishing out bribes in order to further their business interests and influence policy at any cost has once again struck. Just this past August Britain opened a formal investigation into suspicions of corruption at British
articleBody:
The Company that is known the world over for not shying away from dishing out bribes in order to further their business interests and influence policy at any cost has once again struck. Just this past August Britain opened a formal investigation into suspicions of corruption at British American Tobacco (BAT) (BATS.L) and its subsidiaries, nearly two years after allegations of bribery in Africa first surfaced.
“The SFO confirms it is investigating suspicions of corruption in the conduct of business by BAT plc, its subsidiaries, and associated persons,” Britain’s Serious Fraud Office (SFO) said in a statement.
The maker of brands including Dunhill and Lucky Strike said in February last year it had appointed a law firm to investigate allegations of historic misconduct in Africa and that it was liaising with the SFO. The 2016 move came after a November 2015 BBC program described cases of BAT employees bribing officials in East African countries including Rwanda and Burundi in an effort to undermine anti-smoking laws. The BBC cited internal documents provided by whistleblowing former employee Paul Hopkins.
Given that shisha was banned in Rwanda and now Kenya this raises serious questions of the motivation of these bans and indeed it seems BAT is using shisha as a scapegoat to derail the worldwide campaign to curb cigarette smoking
Reliable firsthand information from several Kenyan members of parliament is that millions of shillings passed hands so as to get the ban executed. One wonders whether this disclosure is motivated by honesty or was they simply shortchanged in the transaction. It’s been noted that a certain noisy MP with a leadership role in the house who recently had marital woes has been at the forefront in pushing for the ban and supporting it. He has roped in many into the scheme with the smarter ones receiving millions all the while others who simply do his bidding have been pushing for it ignorantly.
1.4 million shillings was paid to leading social media influencers with the whole online campaign being run by a blogger who is very close to loud-mouthed mouthed politician and whom its said runs his social media accounts, to support the ban and in this realm again some are busy being misused as some of their compatriots run to the bank or shall we say MPESA outlet to withdraw their winnings.
A company known for corruption the world over has found a pliant legislative body and executive with which they are so willing to do their business with. The irony that is lost on may is that while cigarettes kill the tobacco giant has been vilifying shisha as if when shisha is banned cigarettes will magically stop killing people.
If the ban is to have any meaningful impact the cigarettes smoking should also be banned just like shisha or else we are just playing a game of musical chairs whilst corrupt money does the rounds making fools of Kenyans of all cadres.ruption must stop

headline: Breaking News! The Supreme Court of Kenya Upholds Uhuru Kenyatta’s election citing lack of merit in the two petitions
author: The Kenyan Report

breadcrumbs.name: Breaking News! The Supreme Court of Kenya Upholds Uhuru Kenyatta’s election citing lack of merit in the two petitions

description: Special Correspondent, November 20th, 2017 The Supreme Court of Kenya today upheld the election of Uhuru Kenyatta by dismissing the two petitions before them on the basis of merit. In what is reminiscent of 2013 ruling the apex court through the president of the Supreme Court Justice David Maraga read a brief judgement citing lack of
articleBody:
Total Views : 305

Special Correspondent,

November 20th, 2017

The Supreme Court of Kenya today upheld the election of Uhuru Kenyatta by dismissing the two petitions before them on the basis of merit. In what is reminiscent of 2013 ruling the apex court through the president of the Supreme Court Justice David Maraga read a brief judgement citing lack of time for a detailed judgement—Unlike the case that annulled the election of Uhuru on August 8th, 2017—the Chief Justice did not promise a detailed ruling, but insisted it was not possible due to time constraints.

One is left wondering whether it was a predetermined judgment going by pronouncements made by Statehouse operative Denis Itumbi, who a day earlier had stated categorically that the President will be sworn in on the 28th of November for a second term.

The question now remains as to the legitimacy of President Uhuru and his recognition by Kenyans from the regions where no election took place. We predict this ruling will cement the calls for secession by the aggrieved parties who believe they have been robbed of victory a third time.

Some are wondering whether this could be the end of Kenya as one country under God.
